page.title: 13Religion.
page.content: The only church in our area is St.Helen's Church of England Church at Escrick.It is the second church to be erected on the site,and was built in 1857.The parish also includes the villages of Naburn and Stillingfleet, the rector,the Reverend Harris taking services in each of the churches in his parish every Sunday and at other times during the week.He welcomes people of all denominations at his services,appreciating the needs of those of other faiths who do not have a local church.St.Helen's has a set of 8 bells,but there is not a local team of campanologists.There is a lych gate leading to the church yard,where some lovely trees grow.St.Helen's has recently reverted to the mediaeval tradition of using the parish church for social gatherings,such as the Harvest Supper and musical concerts.
